page.title: 09Belmont Farm,Uyeasound.
page.content: At Belmont two brothers run a farm with 498 hectares of rented land and 267 hectares of owned land.Both have houses on the farm.They have had the farm for 16 years and it was run by their father and uncle before them.They occasionally have help but most of the work is done by the family. They keep 605 sheep,21 suckler cattle and 1 bull;and 20 shetland ponies and 2 stallions.They grow 8 hectares of hay, 1 hectare of corn and a few turnips and potatoes. They have a tractor,baler,rotavator and other machinery to help them.Their busiest time is from May through to December. The animals are sold in Autumn to provide livelihood through the year. Most animals are sent by truck to Lerwick and then by boat to Aberdeen.
